headline: Citigroup reverses firearms policy after pressure from Trump administration on big banks
summary: Seven years ago, after the mass school shooting in Parkland, Florida, Citibank became one of the first on Wall Street to make substantive policy changes, enacting rules with companies that sold firearms.

raw.headline: Citigroup reverses firearms policy after pressure from Trump administration on big banks
raw.summary: Seven years ago, after the mass school shooting in Parkland, Florida, Citibank became one of the first on Wall Street to make substantive policy changes, enacting rules with companies that sold firearms.

headline: Citi scraps pro-gun-safety policy amid conservative pressure
summary: The megabank is also updating certain policies to bar discrimination based on political affiliation. "We appreciate the concerns that are being raised regarding 'fair access' to banking services," a Citigroup executive wrote in an internal memo.

raw.headline: Citi scraps pro-gun-safety policy amid conservative pressure
raw.summary: The megabank is also updating certain policies to bar discrimination based on political affiliation. "We appreciate the concerns that are being raised regarding 'fair access' to banking services," a Citigroup executive wrote in an internal memo.

headline: Citi Drops Gun Policy After Trump Accuses Banks of Discriminating
summary: Citigroup  took a stand in America’s gun debate seven years ago when it said it would no longer offer banking services to businesses that sold firearms to people under the age of 21.  The turnaround comes after President Trump, Republican leaders and others have accused the banking industry of discriminating against customers on political grounds.  In a statement Tuesday, Citigroup said it would no longer have a specific policy regarding firearms in light of regulatory developments and concerns about “fair access.”

In a statement Tuesday, Citigroup said it would no longer have a specific policy regarding firearms in light of regulatory developments and concerns about “fair access.”

headline: U.S. Banks' Brokered Deposits Decline For 5th Consecutive Quarter In Q1
summary: Brokered deposits at US banks declined for the fifth quarter in a row as many banks reduce reliance on expensive sources of funding amid the growth of low-cost deposits.
